definition: croquet/goal ball (served by the goal keeper)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: A sport similar to the handball, called croquet, originally existed in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 地处中欧的德国原有类似手球的活动，称为门球。

sentences.english: Main characteristic of gate ball contest is order nature and cyclonite law.
sentences.chinese: 门球竞赛的主要特点是顺序性和周期性规律。

sentences.english: Participating in gateball improves communication within the family or community.
sentences.chinese: 参加门球活动可改善家庭和社区里人际交往。

sentences.english: Gateball is a sport with strong strategic elements and stimulates intellectual engagement .
sentences.chinese: 门球是带有较强的战术成分的运动，它激发智慧比拼。

sentences.english: How did gateball get so popular in Japan so quickly?
sentences.chinese: 门球是怎样在日本迅速风靡起来的？

sentences.english: Try your skill at croquet, billiards and archery or spend an evening in the Card Room.
sentences.chinese: 尝试在门球，台球，射箭，或用在棋牌室一晚的技能。

sentences.english: There is a goal kick, the keeper kicks the ball.
sentences.chinese: 是个门球，守门员将球开出。

definition: corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
